theories.card_other: Fundamental property of matter that causes electromagnetic interactions. Two types: positive and negative. Like charges repel, unlike charges attract. SI unit: coulomb (C). Charge is quantized (comes in multiples of e).
Total electric charge in an isolated system remains constant. Charge cannot be created or destroyed, only transferred. In any process, net charge before equals net charge after.
Charge exists in discrete packets, not continuous. Smallest charge is electron charge e = 1.6 × 10⁻¹⁹ C. Any charge Q = ne where n is integer. Discovered by Millikan's oil drop experiment.

Force between two point charges is directly proportional to product of charges and inversely proportional to square of distance. Acts along line joining charges. Obeys Newton's third law (action-reaction pair).
Net force on a charge due to multiple charges is vector sum of individual forces. Each pair interacts independently. Used to calculate force in systems with many charges.
Region around charge where electric force is experienced. Vector quantity pointing away from positive, toward negative charge. Exists independent of test charge. Visualized using field lines.
Imaginary lines showing direction of electric field. Start on positive charges, end on negative. Never cross each other. Density indicates field strength. Perpendicular to conductor surface.
Measure of electric field passing through a surface. Proportional to number of field lines crossing surface. Maximum when field perpendicular to surface, zero when parallel. SI unit: V·m or N·m²/C.

Total electric flux through closed surface equals enclosed charge divided by ε₀. Relates field to charge distribution. Used to find fields with high symmetry (spherical, cylindrical, planar). Alternative formulation of Coulomb's law.
Electric potential energy per unit charge. Scalar quantity. Work done bringing unit positive charge from infinity to point. SI unit: volt (V). High potential near positive charge, low near negative.
Work done per unit charge moving between two points. Drives current in circuits. Independent of path taken. 1 volt = 1 joule/coulomb. Measured by voltmeter connected in parallel.
Surface where all points have same electric potential. No work needed to move charge along surface. Always perpendicular to electric field lines. Conductors are equipotential surfaces.

Electric field is negative gradient of potential. Field points in direction of maximum potential decrease. Strong field where potential changes rapidly. Field and potential contain same information about charge distribution.

Pair of equal and opposite charges separated by small distance. Has dipole moment p = qd pointing from negative to positive. Important in molecules. Field decreases as 1/r³ (faster than point charge).

Device that stores electric charge and energy. Consists of two conductors separated by insulator. Stores energy in electric field between plates. Used in circuits for filtering, timing, energy storage.
Ability to store charge per unit voltage. Depends on geometry and dielectric. Larger capacitance stores more charge at same voltage. SI unit: farad (F). 1 farad is very large in practice.

Insulating material placed between capacitor plates. Increases capacitance by reducing field. Characterized by dielectric constant K (always ≥ 1). Prevents breakdown, allows higher voltage. Examples: air, paper, ceramic.
Ratio of capacitance with dielectric to capacitance without. Dimensionless quantity. Measures how much material reduces electric field. Vacuum has K = 1, water ~80, air ~1.0006.
Electric potential energy stored in electric field between plates. Energy = ½CV² = ½QV = Q²/2C. Energy density proportional to square of electric field. Released when capacitor discharges.
Same charge on each capacitor. Total voltage divided across capacitors. Equivalent capacitance less than smallest individual. Reciprocal rule: 1/Ceq = 1/C₁ + 1/C₂ + ...
Same voltage across each capacitor. Total charge divided among capacitors. Equivalent capacitance equals sum. Ceq = C₁ + C₂ + ... Increases total capacitance.
Electric field inside conductor is zero. All charge resides on surface. Surface is equipotential. Field just outside perpendicular to surface. Charges distribute to minimize energy.

Hollow conductor shields interior from external electric fields. Electric field inside cavity is zero regardless of external field. Used in Faraday cage. Protects sensitive equipment from interference.
Maximum voltage before dielectric fails and conducts. Causes spark or arc discharge. Depends on material and thickness. For air ~3 × 10⁶ V/m. Limits capacitor voltage rating.
